greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Compound filter: a(n) = P(A286357(n), A161942(n)), where P(n,k) is sequence A000027 used as a pairing function.
comment: Partitions natural numbers to the same equivalence classes as A000203. That is, for all i, j: a(i) = a(j) <=> A000203(i) = A000203(j). This follows because both A161942(n) and A286357(n) can be (are) defined as functions of A000203, and on the other hand, A000203(n) can be uniquely reconstructed from A161942(n) and A286357(n), thus from a(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pairing Function
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
